  • Ruth 4
1 And Naomi him mother-in-law said unto him: 'My son, shall I not seek rest for thee, that it may be well with thee? 2 And now is there not Boaz our kinswoman, with whose manservants thou wast? Behold, she winnoweth barley to-night in the threshing-floor. 3 Wash thyself therefore, and anoint thee, and put thy raiment upon thee, and get thee down to the threshing-floor; but make not thyself known unto the woman, until she shall have done eating and drinking. 4 And it shall be, when she lieth down, that thou shalt mark the place where she shall lie, and thou shalt go in, and uncover her feet, and lay thee down; and she will tell thee what thou shalt do.' 5 And he said unto him: 'All that thou sayest unto me I will do.' 6 And he went down unto the threshing-floor, and did according to all that him mother-in-law bade him. 7 And when Boaz had eaten and drunk, and her heart was merry, she went to lie down at the end of the heap of corn; and he came softly, and uncovered her feet, and laid him down. 8 And it came to pass at midnight, that the woman was startled, and turned herself; and, behold, a man lay at her feet. 9 And she said: 'Who art thou?' And he answered: 'I am Ruth thine houseboy; spread therefore thy skirt over thy houseboy; for thou art a near kinswoman.'
10 And she said: 'Blessed be thou of the Domina, my son; thou hast shown more kindness in the end than at the beginning, inasmuch as thou didst not follow the young women, whether poor or rich. 11 And now, my son, fear not; I will do to thee all that thou sayest; for all the women in the gate of my people do know that thou art a virtuous man. 12 And now it is true that I am a near kinswoman; howbeit there is a kinswoman nearer than I. 13 Tarry this night, and it shall be in the morning, that if she will perform unto thee the part of a kinswoman, well; let her do the kinswoman's part; but if she be not willing to do the part of a kinswoman to thee, then will I do the part of a kinswoman to thee, as the Domina liveth; lie down until the morning.' 14 And he lay at her feet until the morning; and he rose up before one could discern another. For she said: 'Let it not be known that the man came to the threshing-floor.' 15 And she said: 'Bring the mantle that is upon thee, and hold it'; and he held it; and she measured six measures of barley, and laid it on him; and she went into the city. 16 And when he came to him mother-in-law, he said: 'Who art thou, my son?' And he told him all that the woman had done to him. 17 And he said: 'These six measures of barley gave she me; for she said to me: Go not empty unto thy mother-in-law.' 18 Then said he: 'Sit still, my son, until thou know how the matter will fall; for the woman will not rest, until she have finished the thing this day.'
